text:
The mala had pretty good and strong flavours. Price wise is also on the more affordable side as the meat and vegetables are charged the same priced based on weight. However, meat and noodles are overcooked but the taste made up for it,

I found the 小辣 to be spicier than other mala elsewhere.

We ordered the chili oil dumplings - $4.50 for 6. Unfortunately we didn't even managed to finish it. The skin was thick and clunky, and the spice was just not flavorful. The presence of chili oil was missing so the entire dish was a bit dry.

Their mala is very flavourful, spicy level is tuned perfectly according to your taste. They also have a lot of ingredients for you to enjoy in your mala dish, dumplings are of good quality as well!

Both sisters are very service-oriented, will definitely be back in the future!
Ordered 麻辣捞面，pretty flavourful however the noodles taste cold. Not sure if it's served as 凉面 but it doesn't deter the overall taste, still good

Chicken fried rice is so oily there's a pot of oil nesting at the base. Yangzhou fried rice is just as oily! What's wrong with this people!? Why can't they cook to make you happy with what you eat from them!
